element.short: The type of intended use of the medication, e.g. prophylactic, therapeutic, diagnostic, anesthesia, etc.
element.definition: The type of intended use of the medication, e.g. prophylactic, therapeutic, diagnostic, anesthesia, etc.

element.short: Details of how medication is/was taken or should be taken
element.definition: Details of how medication is/was taken or should be taken. This includes the number of units per intake and frequency of intake over a specified duration of time. Example: 1 tablet every 24h, for 10 days .
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS, MyHealth@EU

element.short: Period when patient took, is taking or is expected to take the medication
element.definition: Period when patient took, is taking or is expected to take the medication. This information may be expressed using start and end date times OR indicating the duration. The first is used to indicate a specified interval (e.g., from March 15th, 2017); the latter for indicating a 'floating' period (e.g., 2 weeks). In case of unbounded period (continuous therapy), the end element will be valued with an exceptional value.
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS, MyHealth@EU
